content.description: Stand start on good holds at about face height. Make a big move up and left, then up and right to a juggy sidepull. Another big move out left to a hold on the lip, slap a right heel hook in and go up to the flake on the right. From here go straight on up. Establishing on the vertical face after the lip is probably the crux. Easy climbing up top once your feet are on the face, stay mentally strong, don't fall.
content.location: On the right of the cave.

content.description: Start low in the slot, make a dynamic move to the crimp rail, match, then make another dynamic move to the top. Two move wonder but a fun two moves. You can use the arete on the right if you want a less dynamic approach, but jumping is more fun.
content.location: To the right of the cave.

content.description: Sit start on obvious crimp in the seam, go straight up the slab from here. Nice movement on this one if you ask me.
content.location: To the left and downhill of the cave.

content.description: No idea how to grade this. Start the same as "Log Lady" traverse all the way uphill, through the cave and finish on "The Blue Rose" alternate harder finish is to finish on "Garmonbozia" for the monster difficulty route. Still a project.
content.protection: pads and a spotter to move them around
content.location: Start on log lady, downhill and left of the cave, then just climb the whole damn thing.

content.description: Still a project. Sit start on a crimp slot in the deepest part of the cave. Move out left towards the start of The Blue Rose, then traverse on the vertical face to the right to connect with the end of The Arm using the crimps on the white stone patch. Stay mentally strong at the top, the climbing is easier, but you're in highball territory. My initial attempt at linking the cruxes of other lines to make a harder route.
content.protection: A couple of pads. I recommend not falling off the top.
content.location: Deepest part of the cave on the left.

content.description: Sit start on good crimpy nub, work your way directly up the vertical face using good holds. Start is the crux, gets much easier at the top, but stay calm and focused.
content.location: Left most problem in owl cave.

content.description: Still a project. Stand start on good holds a bit below face height to the left of "The Woodsmen" start holds. Go up and to the left on good sharp holds. Work into the crack on the lip, then transfer to good crimps on the white face on the vertical face. Finish straight up from here. Highball territory, climbing at the top is easier but be safe.

The owls are not what they seem. An impressive cliff that is overhanging or vertical in parts. Lots of highball action, but most of the more difficult moves are at the bottom. In the words of Coop "It's not so bad as long as you can keep the fear from your mind"
